snippet: The Agriculture Department predicted that approval of the genetically engineered crops would vastly increase the use of 2,4-D herbicide.
abstract: Agriculture Dept has approved commercial planting of corn and soybeans genetically engineered to survive being sprayed by herbicide 2,4-D; critics say cultivation of the crops, developed by Dow AgroSciences, will mean a sharp increase in the spraying of 2,4-D, chemical they say is more damaging to the environment, nearby non-engineered crops and possibly human health.
lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department predicted that approval of the genetically engineered crops would vastly increase the use of 2,4-D herbicide.

headline.main: Altered to Withstand Herbicide, Corn and Soybeans Gain Approval
headline.print_headline: Altered to Withstand Herbicide, Corn and Soybeans Gain Approval
